events.originalText: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 was shot down over eastern Ukraine, killing all 298 people on board.
events.subtitle: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17
events.headline: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 shot down over eastern Ukraine, 298 killed

events.originalText: TAM Airlines Flight 3054 overran the runway at Congonhas Airport in São Paulo, Brazil, killing 199 people.
events.subtitle: TAM Airlines Flight 3054
events.headline: TAM Airlines Flight 3054 crashes in São Paulo, Brazil, 199 dead

events.originalText: TWA Flight 800 exploded in mid-air and crashed into the Atlantic Ocean near East Moriches, New York.
events.subtitle: TWA Flight 800
events.headline: TWA Flight 800 explodes and crashes near East Moriches, New York

events.originalText: Queen Elizabeth II officially opened the Manchester Metrolink, the first modern street-running light-rail system in the United Kingdom.
events.subtitle: Elizabeth II
events.headline: Queen Elizabeth II opens Manchester Metrolink in the UK

events.originalText: A structural failure caused a walkway at the Hyatt Regency hotel in Kansas City, Missouri, U.S., to collapse (damage pictured), killing 114 people and injuring 216 others.
events.subtitle: Structural integrity and failure
events.headline: Hyatt Regency hotel walkway collapse in Kansas City kills 114

events.originalText: Led by Ahmed Hassan al-Bakr, the Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party overthrew Iraqi president Abdul Rahman Arif in a bloodless coup.
events.subtitle: Ahmed Hassan al-Bakr
events.headline: Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party overthrows Iraqi president Abdul Rahman Arif

events.originalText: Laden with munitions for World War II, two ships exploded at the Port Chicago Naval Magazine in California, killing 320 people and injuring more than 400 others.
events.subtitle: Port Chicago disaster
events.headline: Explosion at Port Chicago Naval Magazine kills 320 in California

events.originalText: RMS Carpathia, which had rescued survivors of the 1912 Titanic sinking, was sunk by a German U-boat with the loss of five crew.
events.subtitle: RMS Carpathia
events.headline: RMS Carpathia, rescuer of Titanic survivors, sunk by German U-boat

events.originalText: Russian Revolution: Tsar Nicholas II and his family (pictured) were murdered by Bolsheviks at Yekaterinburg.
events.subtitle: Russian Revolution
events.headline: Tsar Nicholas II and family murdered by Bolsheviks in Yekaterinburg

events.originalText: The New Zealand Wars resumed as British forces led by General Duncan Cameron began the invasion of the Waikato.
events.subtitle: New Zealand Wars
events.headline: British forces invade Waikato in New Zealand Wars

events.originalText: The garrotting and robbery of British member of parliament James Pilkington led to a moral panic in London.
events.subtitle: James Pilkington (politician)
events.headline: British MP James Pilkington garrotted and robbed in London

events.originalText: The first astrophotograph of a star other than the Sun, a daguerreotype of Vega (pictured), was taken by William Cranch Bond and John Adams Whipple.
events.subtitle: Astrophotography
events.headline: First astrophotograph of star Vega taken by William Cranch Bond and John Adams Whipple

events.originalText: Dene men, acting as guides to Samuel Hearne on his exploration of the Coppermine River in present-day Nunavut, Canada, massacred a group of about twenty Copper Inuit.
events.subtitle: Dene
events.headline: Dene guides massacre Copper Inuit during Samuel Hearne's exploration in Canada

events.originalText: The Battle of Castillon, the last engagement of the Hundred Years' War, ended with the English losing all holdings in France except the Pale of Calais.
events.subtitle: Battle of Castillon
events.headline: Battle of Castillon ends Hundred Years' War, English lose holdings in France
